abstract: Larry Brilliant, the executive director of Google.org, said he would step down from managing Google’s philanthropic unit.
snippet: Larry Brilliant, the executive director of Google.org, said he would step down from managing Google’s philanthropic unit.
lead_paragraph: SAN FRANCISCO  Larry Brilliant, the executive director of Google.org, said late Monday that he would step down from managing Google’s philanthropic unit and signaled that Google.org might curtail its financing of nonprofit groups unless they are closely aligned with Google projects.

headline.main: Google Chief for Charity Steps Down on Revamp
headline.print_headline: Google Chief For Charity Steps Down On Revamp

abstract: Google’s Gmail and Google Apps services stopped working for four hours Tuesday in the middle of the European business day.
snippet: Google’s Gmail and Google Apps services stopped working for four hours Tuesday in the middle of the European business day.
lead_paragraph: Update | 7:21 p.m. Modified to include Google’s explanation of the cause of the failure.

abstract: The case, initiated by the European Union, accuses Microsoft of illegally tying Internet Explorer to Windows to stifle competition.
snippet: The case, initiated by the European Union, accuses Microsoft of illegally tying Internet Explorer to Windows to stifle competition.
lead_paragraph: SAN FRANCISCO  Accusing Microsoft of unfairly sidelining competitors, Google said on Tuesday that it would apply to join a European Union antitrust case against Microsoft over the company’s Web browser.

headline.main: Google Joins Europe Case Against Microsoft
headline.print_headline: Google Joins Europe Case Against Microsoft
